meanings.definition: To remove the rigging from a ship.
meanings.sent1: I helped unrig the sails on the boat.
meanings.sent2: The sailors unrigged the ship after docking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous pirate tried to unrig the ship for a prank.
meanings.sent4: She unrigged the model ship, revealing its intricate design.
meanings.sent5: The crew worked together to unrig the ship before the storm hit.

meanings.definition: To dismantle or disassemble something, especially in a dishonest or unfair way.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic had to unrig the engine to fix the issue.
meanings.sent2: The scammer tried to unrig the competition by cheating.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to unrig the game by changing the rules secretly.
meanings.sent4: The group conspired to unrig the results of the contest.
meanings.sent5: She discovered someone had unrigged the voting process to win unfairly.
